intro: Delphinium hesperium var. hansenii, commonly known as the Hansen's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are compound, with lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces follicles as its fruit type. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
